content.rendered:
Situated amidst the scenic Western Ghats of India in the palani hill range of the dindugul district, kodaikanal is one of the finest hill stations of Tamil Nadu.The name kodaikanal means “The Gift of forests”. It delivers a visual delight for the tourists filled with luring lake, spectacular slopes, wonderful waterfalls, fenced flower garden and lush vegetation. This place is positioned 7,200 feet above sea level. And so, the climate will be undoubtedly a pleasing one. The specialty about kodai is its Kurinji flowers which bloom around December once in 12 years. Kurinji flower spread itself all along the valley in a beautiful sea of blue. The last full bloom was in 2006 and the next full bloom is expected to be in 2018.

Because of its romantic atmosphere this is the mostly sought as honeymoon destination. Also the Mother Nature embraces the people who come over here with an amiable greeting. Kodaikanal is famous for its homemade chocolates, plums, cheese, etc.

How to reach Kodaikanal:

By Air: The closest airports to Kodaikanal is Madurai airport which is 120 km far and next to it Tiruchy airport at 150 km and Coimbatore airport at 175 km.

By Train: Kodai road is the nearby railway station, at a distance of 100 km.Next to kodai road railway station, dindugal railway station is closer.

By Bus: There are plenty of buses plying from various cities like Chennai, Pondicherry, Trichy, Madurai, Palani and Coimbatore. Kodaikanal is about 90 km from Dindigul city.

By Road/Self Drive: Kodaikanal is 80 km far from Kodai Road. One has to travel for 2 hours from Kodai road or dindugal and for 3.5 hours from Madurai. You can also get to Kodaikanal from Cochin via the hill station of Munnar.

Best Time to Visit Kodaikanal (Weather in Kodaikanal):

Since Kodaikanal is a remarkable hill station and enjoys a pleasant moderate temperature, you could plan your trip anytime.

Summer (March to May): The temperature reaches its maximum of 21°C and falls down to the lowest range of 10°C. It would be the right choice to spend your summer vacation here.

Monsoon (June to October): Both south-west monsoon rain and north-east monsoon rain have its influence in Kodaikanal. Among these north-east monsoon rain is predominant. There will be sudden changes in the temperature during monsoon.

Winter (November to February): The temperature during the months of December to February ranges from 8°C to 17°C. This would be an apt season for sightseeing.

Places to visit in Kodaikanal:

If you have enough time, try spending time in each of these places because each spot will give you an unforgettable memory.

  • Berijam lake
  • Chettiar Park
  • Coakers Walk
  • Bryant park
  • Kodai Lake
  • Echo Point
  • Green Valley View/Suicide Point
  • Silent Valley View
  • Cap’s Fly
  • Devil’s Kitchen
  • Guna Caves
  • Pine Forest
  • Shanthi Valley
  • Silver Cascade
  • Old Suicide Point
  • Bear Shola falls
  • Wax Museum

Temples and Pilgrimage spots in Kodaikanal:

  • Kurinjiandavar Temple
  • Subrahmanya Temple
  • Lutheran Church, Kodaikanal

Things you Shouldn’t miss to do:

  • Cycle around the lake
  • Boating at the Kodai lake
  • Trekking
  • Horse Riding
  • Balloon Shooting
  • Kodaikanal Yoga Center
  • Ram Parai View point
  • Solar planetarium

Kodaikanal is a great destination and a site worth visiting. This princess is definitely going to charm you with all her beauty. Be ready to get mesmerized.Share your experience with us if you have visited Kodaikanal,We will share your story with the world. Keep exploring at Travelamen.

It delivers a visual delight for the tourists filled with luring lake, spectacular slopes, wonderful waterfalls, fenced flower garden and […]

title.rendered: 10 BEST TREE HOUSE RESORTS IN INDIA

content.rendered:
Have you always wanted to live a night, where you can sleep amidst nature, but haven’t been able to live yet? Tree Houses are no doubt the best place to stay in the lap of Nature. They look very romantic and adventurous. You feel like you are living a fairy tale. Tree houses are the ideal destinations to be visited with friends and family. It is an ideal Honeymoon destination too. These tree house resorts provide one with a unique accommodation amidst natural setting. The resorts can be luxurious, rustic, and can provide you a life-long experience.

India has many tree houses, which are the centre-spot of attractions for many tourists from both inside the country and outside. Though there are many tree house resorts in India to make you spell-bound, I am listing the best tree house resorts out of the many, which are sure to provide you an enchanting experience.

1. Vythiri Resort, Wayanad:

It is in Kerala, and is an eco-friendly jungle getaway hidden in the rainforest. The enchanting view from the resort makes everyone spell-bound, and provides them the best experience in the serenity of nature. When you sleep in the lap of nature, you can see the whole forest from the top, and you will be surprised to hear the sounds that nature offers. A candle light dinner in the resort with the person you love, will be awesome.

  • Location: Lakkidi, Wayanad, Kerala (65km From Calicut Railway Station)

  • Facilities Available: Fitness Centre, Spa, Library, Restaurant, Free Parking, Free Wi-Fi

    2. The Machan, Lonavala:

Lonavala is one of the best weekend getaways near Mumbai. One can add some luxury and comfort in his/her stay by booking a room in this resort. This Eco-resort has a tree house rising 30-40 feet above the forest. You can view the jungle and the mountains from this resort. Open Sky bath in the resort provides a spell-bound experience to everyone

  • Location: Private Road, Atvan, Maharastra

  • Facilities Available: Free Wi-Fi, Fitness Centre, Restaurant, Parking

    3. Green Magic Resort, Wayanad:

This resort has everything that a nature lover would want. The enchanting view from the resort makes everyone spell-bind, and provides the best experience in the serenity of nature. One can access this tree house, which is at a height of 86 feet, by an indigenous cane lift. It is Asia’s Highest tree house. The tree house is made of Eco-friendly materials.

  • Location: Wayanad, Kerala(65km From Calicut Railway Station)

  • Facilities Available: Free Wi-Fi, Fitness Centre,Restaurant,Parking

    4. Tree House, Bandhavgarh:

This tree house is equipped with modern facilities and looks like it is a part of a fairy tale. An ideal spot for honeymoon, it’s an excellent place to stay. The hospitality is good, and the quality of food is also awesome. You can really have a good time staying there. You can avail jeep service too for a ride in Badhavgarh National Park

  • Location:Village Vijahria, Bandhavgarh National Park

  • Facilities Available: Free Wi-Fi, Fitness Centre, Restaurant, Parking, Bar

    5. Tree House Cottages, Manali:

Have you ever thought of staying in a tree house on a lovely snowy day and sipping hot tea, while the snow touches the windows? If yes, then this is the perfect place for you. The tree houses in Manali provide all the facilities and attractions that a tourist desires. This place would make you feel like home, because the rooms are designed like that. Everyone visiting Manali should at least spend a night in one of these resorts. You will absolutely love their food and hospitality.

  • Location: Manali, Himachal Pradesh

  • Facilities Available: Free Wi-Fi, Fitness Centre, Restaurant, Parking

    6. Eagle Eye Holiday Resorts, Chikmagalur:

 

Situated at 2900 feet above level, Eagle eye resorts provide everyone a soothing experience. The resort is spread across 130 acres of lush green land, and is absolutely wonderful. You can enjoy your stay in the lap of nature.

  • Location: Hoscodu estate, Kadavanthi Post, Chikmagalur, Karnataka

  • Facilities Available: Free Wi-Fi, Fitness Centre, Restaurant, Parking

    7. Vanya Tree House:

Misty mornings, chirping of birds, and cool breeze will altogether make your stay awesome. It is located about 2000 feet above sea level. The rooms are well designed, and hospitality is also very good. You can go for a honeymoon trip at this place. Especially, for couples who want to spend quality time in the lap of nature.

  • Location: Thekkady, Kerala

  • Facilities Available: Restaurant, intercom

8. The Tree House Resort, Jaipur:

Luxurious stay amidst nature! This is how I’d define this divine place. There are many tree houses in the vicinity of this place, and you can choose the perfect tree house as per your wish. It is located close to NH-8.The greenery, nearby mountains, and rich natural heritage impresses everyone. Hospitality is best in this resort. In one word, its an awesome place with great ambiance.

  • Location: Opposite Amity University, Jaipur, Rajasthan

  • Facilities Available: Restaurant, Fitness Centre, Parking

    9. Nature Zone Resort, Munnar:

Here, the tree houses are build on living tress, and is one of the best place to live in Munnar for tourists. The sun rays peeping through leaves and the chirping of birds impresses everyone. Get away from the busy city life, and have a relaxing stay here.

  • Location: Pulippara, Pallivasal, Munnar

  • Facilities Available: Restaurant, Parking

    10. Safari Land Resorts, Masinagudi:

It is an eco-friendly jungle getaway. This resort is surrounded by deep Valleys, waterfalls, rivers and streams. Excellent rooms, wonderful location, and great hospitality makes this place unique.

  • Location: Bokkapuram, Masinagudi, Tamil Nadu

  • Facilities Available: Restaurant, Parking

There are many other tree house resorts in India like Shola Periyar Tree House, Tranquil Resort-Plantation, Wild Canopy Nature Reserve etc. If you are planning for a relaxing and out the city staying holiday, you must visit these resorts. Relax yourself in the lap of nature with the therapeutic sound of birds and cool breeze. These resorts are a must stay destination for everyone. One is sure to cherish the memories of his/her stay in these awesome and breath-taking places throughout their entire life. I bet!

excerpt.rendered: Have you always wanted to live a night, where you can sleep amidst nature, but haven’t been able to live yet? Tree Houses are no doubt the best place to stay in the lap of Nature. They look very romantic and adventurous. You feel like you are living a fairy tale. Tree houses are the ideal […]

title.rendered: 10 BEST THINGS TO DO IN INDIA BEFORE YOU DIE

content.rendered:
Have you ever thought of spending your money in exploring the unexplored areas of India, or by doing some fun and entertainment? If yes, its high time you spent your money at the right place. Get yourself in touch with some trips in coastal areas, gift yourself an exotic honeymoon to Andaman, Gamble in Goa, or have some fun by trekking. India has an access to all the exciting activities, which everyone must try before dieing. Though, there are many places to visit, and many things to do, I am listing the best 10 things to do in India before you die.

 

1. Gambling In Goa:

Get into a casino in Goa, and gamble like there is no tomorrow. All the top rated casinos of India are located in Goa. Take a drink, have some continental food, and spend your money in gambling. The more you play cleverly, more becomes the chance of getting your amount doubled. It’s an ideal destination to visit with friends. Casinos also have discos inside. Have a hard drink, gamble, roam around, and dance like never before. A “must visit” place for all.

Best Time To Visit: November to February
How To Go: Goa is linked with many cities via train, bus and flights. Flights and trains are available from Kolkata, Chennai, Hyderabad, Delhi, Mumbai, Bangalore on daily basis. Buses are also available from Mumbai, Hyderabad, Bangalore
Activities to do: Going to Casino, Scuba Diving , Hot Air Balloon , Parasailing.

 

2. Go for An exotic Honeymoon To Andaman:

If you are a travel loving couple, then travel to Andaman. This place is free from the busy city life and you can enjoy a peaceful stay here. Take a ride in a glass bottom boat to view underwater life, chill out in the beach, book a resort, have a candle night dinner, check out some of the best wines available there. This place is a “must visit “for all.

Best Time To Visit: October To February
How To Go: Andaman is connected to all major Indian cities via Flight and Ship service. Ships are available from Chennai, Kolkata and Vishakhapatnam. Flights are available from Chennai, Mumbai, Kolkata, Delhi, Vizag up to Port Blair.
Activities to do: Snorkeling, Scuba Diving.

 

3. Stay In a Rented House-boat in Alleppey:

Best place to relax a bit. Have you ever wanted to explore the open seas? Have you ever wanted to spend your time in a boat and enjoy exotic life? Then this the perfect destination for you. The backwaters surrounded by natural beauty enchants everyone. Have the taste of fresh authentic Kerala food and sea food inside boat house. Take a drink, and enjoy a relaxing stay.

Best Time To Visit: October To February
How To Go: 53 km from Cochin, the capital city of Kerala (1hr 5mins, self drive).Taxis and buses are available from Kochi
Activities to do: Boating, Sightseeing

 

4. Take a Road-Trip Across Coastal India:

The best way to explore India is by taking a road trip. Best Coastal areas are Chennai, Kerala and Goa.The fancy highways, interior roads, beautiful landscapes, small towns along the way impresses everyone and provides a soothing experience. Go to the beach, eat sea foods, drink beer, and have some continental food, stay at a resort in Goa, and enjoy the serenity of Nature in Kerala. The Road trip will fascinate you in all respects. You can see many mountains, rivers, temples, waterfalls along side roads.

Best Time To Visit: October To February
How To Go: Chennai,Goa and Kerala are connected with almost all major Indian cities. You can take a straight way drive from Mumbai to Goa,Goa To Kerala and Kerala To Chennai.
Activities to do: Sight-Seeing

 

5. Camp under open night sky at Kinner Camps, Sangla:

Probably the best place to do camping in India. The Baspa River flows between the camps. The beautiful mountains, the gushing sound of water, adds extra flavour to camping in this place. The river is at a walking distance of 4-5minutes from this place. Sit near bonfire, eat some local food, do some trekking, and have a view of the rich natural serenity. This place is the perfect place for visiting with friends and relaxing on the lap of nature.

Best Time To Visit: October To February
How To Go: Buses and taxis are available from Shimla on daily basis. Trains are available up to Shimla from Delhi, Mumbai, and all other major Indian cities.
Activities to do: Camping, Trekking, Swimming

 

6.Stay At a Heritage Resort In Udaipur:

This destination is one of the best destinations for couples to stay for a night or two. Resorts in Udaipur are unique of its kind. Udaipur is considered as one of the best romantic cities of India because of the presence of famed lakes and palaces. Sothis is undoubtedly a perfect honeymoon destination. The best palace is the Taj Lake Palace. The wonderful and splendid architecture of the palace impresses everyone. Services offered here are good. Rich cultural heritage and tradition of Rajasthan are reflected from the architecture of these palaces.

Best Time To Visit: October to March
How To Go: Trains, buses, taxis are available from Jaipur to Udaipur. Jaipur is connected via Train, Bus and flight service with all major Indian Cities.
Activities to do: Sight-Seeing

 

7. Have a Visit to Varkala, Kerala:

This place is probably one of the best places in Kerala. The cliffs, greenery, and the sea combine to make the kind of awesome landscape that one can just relax. The Ayurvedic centres in Varkala that will help one’s body to get relaxed. One can stay at one of the cottage-style homes and can enjoy a peaceful climate, that will boost his mental condition and will reduce stress. A perfect destination for everyone.

Best Time To Visit: October To February
How To Go: Trains are available from Cochin. Buses are also available on daily basis.
Activities to do: Sight-Seeing

 

8. Visit Agatti Island:

This beautiful island makes everyone spell bound by its unparallel beauty. The snorkelling is amazing. The crystal clear water of the sea and blue lagoons in the island impresses everyone. Stay in a beach side resort, enjoy continental food, have a drink and relax in the serenity of surroundings.

Best Time To Visit: December To March
How To Go: Nearest Railway Station in Kochi (458km from Agatti). Flights are available from Kochi to Agatti Island
Activities to do: Swimming, sightseeing

 

9. Visit Gangtok:

Gangtok, also called as the clean city, is perhaps one of the best destinations to travel friends and family. The city is refreshingly clean and well organized, and many tourists spend many days here to make travel arrangements and see the beautiful and fascinating sights. Gangtok is a real destination for nature lovers. It is undoubtedly the ideal place for tourists as the city is located in the eastern Himalayas range and features an excellent variety of flora and fauna in addition to a wider range of mountains and hill peaks, which gives this place a perfect taste.

Best Time To Visit: October To November
How to go: Nearest Airport is Bagdogra Airport. Helicopter service is available from Bagdogra Airport to Gangtok. Also nearest station is New Jalpaiguri station. Various buses and taxies are available from new jalpaiguri station to Gangtok.
Activities To Do: Trekking, Hot Air Balloon Ride

 

10. Visit Kamshet:

This place is just an ultimate destination for peace-lovers. Mountains, Lakes, Flora and fauna around the place will blow anyone’s kind. It’s a must visit place for Paragliding lovers. A reservoir is also present here and one can enjoy wading and swimming. The lake is very beautiful and its beauty is unparallel with any other attraction in this place.

Best Time To Visit: December To March
How To Go: Trains & Taxis are available from Mumbai on daily basis.
Activities to do: Swimming, Paragliding
Other attractions: Bhaja Caves, Kondeshwar Temple, Bedse Caves, Karla Caves, Forts.

Do these 10 things before you die. Visit the places, have a road trip, and enjoy in the beautiful beaches of India. Just take out 1 month from your daily work and live life for a while. People say, “Money can’t buy happiness”. But this proverb will definitely be proved wrong, once you get to live for some days in these places. One will surely remember his/her visit to these places for a life time.

If yes, its high time you spent your money at the right place. Get yourself in touch with some trips in coastal areas, gift yourself an exotic honeymoon to Andaman, Gamble in Goa, or have […]
